Structs/Color.html.name: Color
Structs/Color.html.abstract: Captures colors in a platform independent way for subsequent specialization.

Structs/Point.html.name: Point
Structs/Point.html.abstract: The Point generic captures a single in space.

Structs/Dimension.html.name: Dimension
Structs/Dimension.html.abstract: A generic type that stores a 2D dimenion (with width and height)

Structs/Rectangle.html.name: Rectangle
Structs/Rectangle.html.abstract: A generic type that captrues a rectangular region in 2D space with an origin and size

Structs/BridgedProperty.html.name: BridgedProperty
Structs/BridgedProperty.html.abstract: Provides a concreate wrapper to store mapped properties

Structs/ImageReference.html.name: ImageReference
Structs/ImageReference.html.abstract: Captures a resolved reference to an image, including its dimensions

Structs/Group.html.name: Group
Structs/Group.html.abstract: A Group represents the collection of Layers a Tiled Group Layer contains (a Layer.Kind of .group)

Structs/ObjectLayer.html.name: ObjectLayer
Structs/ObjectLayer.html.abstract: Provides an immutable view of a Layer that is an object layer

Structs/Layer.html.name: Layer
Structs/Layer.html.abstract: Layers capture the contents of a Map can be one of four kinds

Structs/TileFlip.html.name: TileFlip
Structs/TileFlip.html.abstract: Captures if and how a Tile should be rendered

Structs/TileGID.html.name: TileGID
Structs/TileGID.html.abstract: Represents the reference to a specific Tile in a tile Layer for a given Map. It captures not only an identifier uniquely identifying the Tile (and the TileSet it is in) but also if the Tile should be flipped (see TileFlip)

Structs/TileGrid.html.name: TileGrid
Structs/TileGrid.html.abstract: Represents a two dimensional grid of tiles (such as that in a tile Layer

Structs/Map.html.name: Map
Structs/Map.html.abstract: Represents a Tiled map which can be loaded from a Tiled tmx file (other Tiled formats can be supported in the future, such as JSON). It contains the root collection of Layers as well as carrying the references to the TileSets used by the Map

Structs/Object.html.name: Object
Structs/Object.html.abstract: Represents a Tiled object (which are contained inside Object Layers). All objects share some common attributes (e.g. their position inside their containing Layer).

Structs/ObjectTypes.html.name: ObjectTypes
Structs/ObjectTypes.html.abstract: Object types represent pre-defined sets of objects that can be applied to Tiled objects. ObjectTypes captures

Structs/ObjectType.html.name: ObjectType
Structs/ObjectType.html.abstract: An ObjectType captures a set of properties and their default values that can be applied to any

Structs/TextStyle.html.name: TextStyle
Structs/TextStyle.html.abstract: Represents the formating and style of text Objects.

Structs/Frame.html.name: Frame
Structs/Frame.html.abstract: Frames are attached to Tiles and reference another Tile within the same Tile Set as well as the duration it that Tile should be displayed

Structs/TileSetReference.html.name: TileSetReference
Structs/TileSetReference.html.abstract: TileSets are referenced by Maps, and all tile Layers reference a specific Tile and TileSet by using a TileGID. The TileSetReference type

Classes/Project.html#/s:8TiledKit7Projec.abstract: Loads a Map from the project with the specied name (and optionally subdirectory). Note that you do not have to include the

Classes/Project.html#/s:8TiledKit7Projec.name: retrieve(asType:from:relativeTo:)
Classes/Project.html#/s:8TiledKit7Projec.abstract: Loads a URL for a resource (which can be relative to another resource in the project, very useful as Tiled often uses relative paths within projects, or across Maps and Tile Sets).

Classes/Project.html#/s:8TiledKit7Projec.name: store(_:as:)
Classes/Project.html#/s:8TiledKit7Projec.abstract: Stores an asset in the Projects resource cache for later retreival via the supplied URL. In this way ResourceLoaders can exploit the ability

Classes/Project.html#/s:8TiledKit7Projec.abstract: Retreive a specialized map for a specific game engine. Note that the exact specialization will be determined by the

Classes/MapTiles.html#/s:8TiledKit8MapTi.name: subscript(_:)
Classes/MapTiles.html#/s:8TiledKit8MapTi.abstract: Access the the Engine specific tile that was created during the map loading

Classes/MapTiles.html.name: MapTiles
Classes/MapTiles.html.abstract: Stores the tiles for a map so that they can be retreived as layers and objects are created

Classes/Project.html.name: Project
Classes/Project.html.abstract: Projects are the primary entry point for TiledKit. The project represents the root of all Maps and TileSets and the resources (such as images) that support them.

Classes/Tile.html.name: Tile
Classes/Tile.html.abstract: A Tile represents a 2D image that should be rendered when referenced on by an Object or Layer.

Classes/TileSet.html.name: TileSet
Classes/TileSet.html.abstract: A TileSet represents a Tiled tile set, most typically loaded as part of loading a Map.

Typealiases.html.name: Type Aliases
Typealiases.html.abstract: The following type aliases are available globally.
